channel.title: Heatage
channel.description:
Was wondering if my pc is over heating..9800gt btw.
While playing games Core is 61c and gpu is 51c
Any idea on how to lower it? Other than raising fan speed? Already at 50%
Edit:
Fans @ 50-57% and my cores idling is 43-47c and my graphics card is 49-51. That normal? [I'm not sure since I just installed my 9800gt]
Yeah and when I play games core is around 55-60 and gpu is around 50-57
Also my fans are a tad bit dusty. Haven't cleaned since I bought. Any one know a good way to clean it? Might buy some canned air at bestbuy and use that..

item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

i just blow on it

Read full topic

item.title: Heatage
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“933pm, post:16, topic:298972”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=395325.msg2937661#msg2937661 date=1251655655]
i just use a hair dryer to blow the dust out
[/quote]

Can cause damage by heat[/quote]
nah, my blow dryer has a ‘cool’ button that doesnt warm up the air it blows. so its room temperature

Read full topic

item.title: Heatage
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“933pm, post:16, topic:298972”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=395325.msg2937661#msg2937661 date=1251655655]
i just use a hair dryer to blow the dust out

Blow dryers aren’t that hot. A computer would run much hotter then a blow dryer. Plus most of them have a setting for cool air[/quote]

Or you can just not risk fucking your computer for enough air that will be able to clean your computer out 50 times+ and only at the cost of $15

Read full topic

item.title: Heatage
item.dc:creator: @933pm 933pm
item.description:
@933pm wrote:

la­wl:

i just use a hair dryer to blow the dust out

Can cause damage by heat

[quote=“Rictoo, post:8, topic:298972”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=395325.msg2937273#msg2937273 date=1251635781]
A tad bit off-topic: with canned air, do you mean pure oxygen in a can or really just air in a can?
[/quote]

A can of air is composed of various gases compressed until they’re liquid. When you let out the valve they quickly turn back into decompressed gas moving at a high velocity.[/quote]

They stay liquid and burn like hell if you hold it upside down… learned the hard way

Read full topic

item.title: Heatage
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:14, topic:298972”][quote author=cows_be_sacred link=topic=395325.msg2937630#msg2937630 date=1251653892]

A tad bit off-topic: with canned air, do you mean pure oxygen in a can or really just air in a can?

A can of air is composed of various gases compressed until they’re liquid. When you let out the valve they quickly turn back into decompressed gas moving at a high velocity.

Yeah hopefully if I clean out the fans and everything it’ll go down to 40c at idle. [Maybe I can even raise fan speed to 55 or 60%]
[/quote]

Meh, my fans are on 100% constantly but play a bit of music and you can’t hear.[/quote]
My fans start to get loud around 65-70%. I can really only bear until 70%

Read full topic

item.title: Heatage
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

A tad bit off-topic: with canned air, do you mean pure oxygen in a can or really just air in a can?

A can of air is composed of various gases compressed until they’re liquid. When you let out the valve they quickly turn back into decompressed gas moving at a high velocity.
[/quote]
Yeah hopefully if I clean out the fans and everything it’ll go down to 40c at idle. [Maybe I can even raise fan speed to 55 or 60%][/quote]

Meh, my fans are on 100% constantly but play a bit of music and you can’t hear.

Read full topic

item.title: Heatage
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

cows_be_sacred:

@rip rsc its pure oxygen and no moisture. They are made especially for clean computers

It’s not pure oxygen, or it would be extremely flammable and if you accidentally sprayed it on a spark or oil it would explode, killing you. It is just as Rictoo said.

I clean my computer out with an air nozzle attached to an air compressor.

Read full topic

item.title: Heatage
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“Davidude, post:4, topic:298972”]Those temperatures are all fine, I’d start to worry if they were 70c+
my old computer used to get to about 80c when playing intense games, then it’d shut off about 82-83 which was annoying.

So don’t worry about it.[/quote]
Thanks

@rip rsc its pure oxygen and no moisture. They are made especially for clean computers

Read full topic

@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

A tad bit off-topic: with canned air, do you mean pure oxygen in a can or really just air in a can?
